001/*

005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.item.atomic;
007
008import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.function.ArithmeticFunctionException;
009import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.function.FunctionUtils;
010import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.function.InvalidValueForCastFunctionException;
011import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.type.IAtomicOrUnionType;
012import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.type.InvalidTypeMetapathException;
013import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.type.impl.TypeConstants;
014import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.util.ObjectUtils;
015
016import java.math.BigDecimal;
017import java.math.BigInteger;
018import java.math.MathContext;
019import java.math.RoundingMode;
020
021import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
022
023/**
024 * Represents an atomic Metapath item containing a numeric data value, which can
025 * be either an integer or decimal. This interface provides operations for
026 * numeric type conversion, comparison, and mathematical operations commonly
027 * used in Metapath expressions.
028 *
029 * @see IIntegerItem
030 * @see IDecimalItem
031 */
032public interface INumericItem extends IAnyAtomicItem {
033  /**
034   * Get the type information for this item.
035   *
036   * @return the type information
037   */
038  @NonNull
039  static IAtomicOrUnionType<INumericItem> type() {
040    return TypeConstants.NUMERIC_TYPE;
041  }
042
043  /**
044   * Cast the provided type to this item type.
045   *
046   * @param item
047   *          the item to cast
048   * @return the original item if it is already this type, otherwise a new item
049   *         cast to this type
050   * @throws InvalidValueForCastFunctionException
051   *           if the provided {@code item} cannot be cast to this type
052   */
053  @NonNull
054  static INumericItem cast(@NonNull IAnyAtomicItem item) {
055    try {
056      return item instanceof INumericItem
057          ? (INumericItem) item
058          : IDecimalItem.valueOf(item.asString());
059    } catch (IllegalStateException | InvalidTypeMetapathException ex) {
060      // asString can throw IllegalStateException exception
061      throw new InvalidValueForCastFunctionException(ex);
062    }
063  }
064
065  /**
066   * Get this item's value as a decimal.
067   *
068   * @return the equivalent decimal value
069   */
070  @NonNull
071  BigDecimal asDecimal();
072
073  /**
074   * Get this item's value as an integer.
075   *
076   * @return the equivalent integer value
077   */
078  @NonNull
079  BigInteger asInteger();
080
081  /**
082   * Get the effective boolean value of this item based on
083   * <a href="https://www.w3.org/TR/xpath-31/#id-ebv">XPath 3.1</a>.
084   *
085   * @return the effective boolean value
086   */
087  boolean toEffectiveBoolean();
088
089  @Override
090  INumericItem castAsType(IAnyAtomicItem item);
091
092  /**
093   * Get the absolute value of the item.
094   *
095   * @return this item negated if this item is negative, or the item otherwise
096   */
097  @NonNull
098  INumericItem abs();
099
100  /**
101   * Round the value to the whole number closest to positive infinity.
102   *
103   * @return the rounded value
104   */
105  @NonNull
106  IIntegerItem ceiling();
107
108  /**
109   * Round the value to the whole number closest to negative infinity.
110   *
111   * @return the rounded value
112   */
113  @NonNull
114  IIntegerItem floor();
115
116  /**
117   * Round the item's value with zero precision.
118   * <p>
119   * This is the same as calling {@link #round(IIntegerItem)} with a precision of
120   * {@code 0}.
121   *
122   * @return the rounded value
123   */
124  @NonNull
125  default INumericItem round() {
126    return round(IIntegerItem.ZERO);
127  }
128
129  /**
130   * Round the item's value with the specified precision.
131   * <p>
132   * This is the same as calling {@link #round(IIntegerItem)} with a precision of
133   * {@code 0}.
134   *
135   * @param precisionItem
136   *          the precision indicating the number of digits to round to before
137   *          (negative value} or after (positive value) the decimal point.
138   * @return the rounded value
139   */
140  @NonNull
141  default INumericItem round(@NonNull IIntegerItem precisionItem) {
142    int precision;
143    try {
144      precision = FunctionUtils.asInteger(precisionItem);
145    } catch (ArithmeticException ex) {
146      throw new ArithmeticFunctionException(ArithmeticFunctionException.OVERFLOW_UNDERFLOW_ERROR,
147          "Numeric operation overflow/underflow.", ex);
148    }
149    return precision >= 0
150        ? roundWithPositivePrecision(precision)
151        : roundWithNegativePrecision(precision);
152  }
153
154  @NonNull
155  private INumericItem roundWithPositivePrecision(int precision) {
156    INumericItem retval;
157    if (this instanceof IIntegerItem) {
158      retval = this;
159    } else {
160      BigDecimal value = asDecimal();
161      BigDecimal rounded = value.signum() == -1
162          ? value.round(new MathContext(precision + value.precision() - value.scale(), RoundingMode.HALF_DOWN))
163          : value.round(new MathContext(precision + value.precision() - value.scale(), RoundingMode.HALF_UP));
164      retval = castAsType(IDecimalItem.valueOf(ObjectUtils.notNull(rounded)));
165    }
166    return retval;
167  }
168
169  /**
170   * Rounds a number to the specified negative precision by: 1. Computing the
171   * divisor (10^|precision|) 2. If the absolute value is less than the divisor,
172   * returns 0 3. Otherwise, rounds to the nearest multiple of the divisor
173   *
174   * @param precision
175   *          the negative precision to round to
176   * @return the rounded value
177   */
178  @NonNull
179  private INumericItem roundWithNegativePrecision(int precision) {
180    BigInteger value = asInteger();
181    BigInteger divisor = BigInteger.TEN.pow(0 - precision);
182
183    INumericItem retval;
184    if (divisor.compareTo(value.abs()) > 0) {
185      retval = IIntegerItem.ZERO;
186    } else {
187      BigInteger remainder = value.mod(divisor);
188      BigInteger lessRemainder = value.subtract(remainder);
189      BigInteger halfDivisor = divisor.divide(BigInteger.TWO);
190      BigInteger roundedValue = remainder.compareTo(halfDivisor) >= 0
191          ? lessRemainder.add(divisor)
192          : lessRemainder;
193      retval = IIntegerItem.valueOf(ObjectUtils.notNull(roundedValue));
194    }
195    return retval;
196  }
197}
